titleStmt.title: Isaac Fitzpatrick et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG12002

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 37th - 76th Regiments Enrolled Militia Primary Source Documents (1861-1866)

body.p:
In camp Louisa Ky June 27th 1864
His Excelency
Thos C. Bramlett
Govenor of Ky

Dear Sir we the undersigned citizens of Johnson County State of Ky Between the ages of eighteen and forty five and now in the Military service of Ky camped at Louisa Ky Respectfuly represents and showeth that we are not satisfied with our present colonel Burgess Preston who was appointed to said position we therefore ask that we have the privilege of exercising our Election Franchise and choosing from among our ranks at our next august Election a Colonel and Lieutenat Colonel If not incompatible with the public interest this we claim as our privilege If it does not work detrimental to the great cause in which our national arms are now thinking strugling we do not petition thus on account of any charge against our present colonel or any that could be made for we look upon him as Being above reproach but only
that we may have a choice at the Ballot Box who it is that shall be our military commander
If these are our rights we Respectfully ask them If not we humbly acquiesse as loyal citizens to the laws of our country

Respectfully yours
Isac Fitchparick
Andrew Wiley
George W Soward
Joseph P Turner
John H Dixon
W J Conley
Willy Davis
C G Rule
John Turner
Wiley Hammons
Charles Fitchpatrick
George. N.

65 Johnson
Ky State Militia
Louisa, Lawrence Co. Ky.
June 27. 1864
Isaac. Fitzpatrick &c of the 65th E. M. Johnson Co.

A petition to the Gov. and by him referred, which is signed by about 165 members of this Reg. Praying to be allowed the privilege of electing their Col & Lieut Col at the next Aug. election. If they have the right to elect they demand the exercise of it; if not they submit. Are dissatisfied with Col Preston though no charges can be brought against him The Reg. is now on duty at Louisa Lawrence Co. Ky.

Answered July 22nd 1864 on L. B. Page 525. See also page 524 the same letter but addressed to different parties
Rec. I. G. O. July 13th 1864
